RESOLVED_ENTITIES.United States v. Maria De Jesus Garcia: United States v. Maria De Jesus Garcia
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the United States District Court: United States v. Maria De Jesus Garcia

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.undocumented aliens: individuals being smuggled, possibly hidden in a vehicle with fogged windows on a cold night, characterized by unwashed and unkempt appearance, suspected to be in vehicles stopped by Border Patrol agents near the United States-Mexican border, attempting to evade detection, exhibiting efforts to avoid detection by ducking and scrambling, admitted to being undocumented
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.pickup truck camper: vehicle used for smuggling undocumented aliens on Interstate Highway 35, characterized by heavy loading and difficulty in handling, subject of a suppression motion regarding evidence obtained during its stop and search, with factors such as appearance, behavior of the driver, and number and appearance of passengers considered in determining justification for the stop, stopped more than 100 miles from the United States-Mexican border, often having fogged windows, exhibiting an unusually heavy and overloaded appearance
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia: defendant in a court case involving allegations of smuggling undocumented aliens, arguing against the use of the modified Allen charge, seeking post-verdict discovery through juror depositions and interrogatories to determine potential coercion by the modified Allen charge
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Maria De Jesus Garcia: court case involving Maria De Jesus Garcia, focusing on the coercive nature of the modified Allen charge given to the jury, addressing the issue of post-verdict discovery to assess potential juror coercion
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Pena-Cantu: court case referenced in the context of the modified Allen charge
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Pacheco: court case referenced in the context of the modified Allen charge
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Orona-Sanchez: court case referenced in the context of the modified Allen charge
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.TATE: Circuit Judge, dissenting in United States v. Maria De Jesus Garcia
